sentence.Network_en: Once at Elgin day-trippers visit a number of local sights.
sentence.Network_cn: 一到达埃尔金，一日游的游客就参观了一些当地的风景名胜。

sentence.Network_en: Among the most spectacular sights are the great sea-bird colonies.
sentence.Network_cn: 庞大的海鸟群是最壮观的景象之一。

sentence.Network_en: We just do not set our sights high enough.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们设定的目标不够高远。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Any sights could pierce them ., 任何景色都会刺激他们.
sightly 美丽的, sights 景观, sights 情景
talking about tourist sights in shanghai ., 谈论上海的旅游景点.
how to brush up those overtax sights ., 要怎样擦亮那些伤神的眼光.

list.abs: 6. 看得到;在视力范围之内 in sight, came in sight of, 一个地方的名胜, 失明, 在某人看来, 看不见, 一看见,, 看见乍一看;初见, 面熟, 7. 原因.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... catch sight of 发现，看到，突然看见 in sight 被见到，看得见；在望 lose sight of 不再看见；忽略；忘记.

entry.def: Someone's sight is their ability to see.

example.ex: My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more...
example.tran: 我的视力在下降，看不了书了。

example.ex: I use the sense of sound much more than the sense of sight.
example.tran: 我用听觉比视觉要多得多。

entry.def: The sight of something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it.

example.ex: I faint at the sight of blood...
example.tran: 我一见到血就晕。

example.ex: The sight of him entering a room could flood her with desire.
example.tran: 见到他进入房间会让她心中欲望澎湃。

entry.def: A sight is something that you see.

example.ex: The practice of hanging clothes across the street is a common sight in many parts of the city...
example.tran: 街边晾晒衣服在这座城市的许多地区随处可见。

example.ex: We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home...
example.tran: 我们目睹了一家人正在收拾家当准备离开的凄惨景象。

entry.def: If you sight someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: The security forces sighted a group of young men that had crossed the border...
example.tran: 安全部队突然看见一群越过边境的年轻人。

example.ex: A fleet of French ships was sighted in the North Sea.
example.tran: 在北海突然发现了一支法国船队。

entry.def: The sights of a weapon such as a rifle are the part which helps you aim it more accurately.
The sights are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists.

example.ex: We'd toured the sights of Paris...
example.tran: 我们游览了巴黎的风景名胜。

example.ex: I am going to show you the sights of our wonderful city...
example.tran: 我会带你浏览我们这座美丽城市的风景名胜。

entry.def: You can use a sight to mean a lot. For example, if you say that something is a sight worse than it was before, you are emphasizing that it is much worse than it was.

example.ex: She's been no more difficult than most daughters and a sight better than some I could mention...
example.tran: 与大多数女儿相比，她并不算太难管，而且比我知道的一些要乖巧得多。

example.ex: We weren't doing anything different to what we've always done. We're just doing it a damn sight quicker.
example.tran: 我们正在做的事和我们一直在做的别无二致，只不过我们现在动作要快得多。

entry.def: If you catch sight of someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly.

example.ex: Then he caught sight of her small black velvet hat in the crowd...
example.tran: 然后他突然在人群中看见了她那顶小巧的黑色天鹅绒帽子。

example.ex: Every time I catch sight of myself in the mirror, I feel so disappointed.
example.tran: 每次我瞥见镜子里的自己就觉得沮丧。

entry.tran: 乍一看;一见之下;初看时
entry.def: If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics at first sight, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it but later it is found to be different.

example.ex: It promised to be a more difficult undertaking than might appear at first sight...
example.tran: 那项任务可能比乍看之下还要困难。

example.ex: At first sight it resembles a traditional village of two-storeyed, balconied houses, set among well-tended gardens.
example.tran: 乍一看，它就像个传统的村庄：带阳台的两层楼房坐落于精心照料的花园中。

entry.def: If something is in sight or within sight, you can see it. If it is out of sight, you cannot see it.

example.ex: The sandy beach was in sight...
example.tran: 沙滩映入眼帘。

example.ex: The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel...
example.tran: 从宾馆可以看见大西洋海岸。

entry.tran: 在望;在即;临近;即将产生
entry.def: If a result or a decision is in sight or within sight, it is likely to happen within a short time.

example.ex: An agreement on many aspects of trade policy was in sight...
example.tran: 一项涉及到贸易政策诸多方面的协议即将达成。

example.ex: There is no end in sight to the struggle for power...
example.tran: 权力的争斗近期不会终止。

entry.def: If you lose sight of an important aspect of something, you no longer pay attention to it because you are worrying about less important things.

example.ex: In some cases, US industry has lost sight of customer needs in designing products...
example.tran: 某些情况下，美国工业在产品设计上忽略了客户的需求。

example.ex: We shouldn't lose sight of the fact that education is important for its own sake.
example.tran: 教育本身就很重要，我们不应忽视这一事实。

entry.def: If you know someone by sight, you can recognize them when you see them, although you have never met them and talked to them.

example.ex: I knew him by sight but had never spoken with him.
example.tran: 我和他有过几面之缘，但从未说过话。

entry.def: If you say 'out of sight, out of mind', you mean that people quickly forget someone if he or she goes away.

example.ex: The problems of the poor are largely invisible—out of sight, out of mind.
example.tran: 穷人的问题人们大多看不见——正所谓“眼不见，心不烦”。

entry.def: If someone is ordered to do something on sight, they have to do it without delay, as soon as a person or thing is seen.

example.ex: Troops shot anyone suspicious on sight...
example.tran: 部队士兵一见到任何可疑的人马上就开枪。

example.ex: Magee was set free but British authorities were asked to arrest him on sight.
example.tran: 马吉被释放了，但是英国当局却被要求一见到他就立即逮捕。

entry.tran: 不好看;不雅观;有碍观瞻
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is not a pretty sight, you mean that it is not pleasant to look at.

example.ex: The bathroom is not a pretty sight. The wallpaper's peeling, the tiles are crumbling.
example.tran: 浴室破旧不堪。墙纸剥落了，瓷砖也裂了。

entry.tran: 以…为奋斗目标;志在必得;决心做到
entry.def: If you set your sights on something, you decide that you want it and try hard to get it.

example.ex: They have set their sights on the world record...
example.tran: 他们的目标是冲击世界纪录。

example.ex: Although she came from a family of bankers, Franklin set her sights on a career in scientific research.
example.tran: 尽管出身于银行家家庭，富兰克林还是决心从事科研事业。

entry.tran: 在未见实物的情况下;事先未经检查
entry.def: If you agree to buy something sight unseen, you agree to buy it, even though you have not seen it and do not know what condition it is in.

example.ex: Although people sometimes buy property sight unseen, it's a remarkably bad idea.
example.tran: 尽管人们有时没看房就买了房，但这真是一个很糟糕的主意。

auth_sentence.content: He sights down the line of his extended pencil.
auth_sentence.res_content: He sights down the line of his extended pencil.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He sights down the line of his extended pencil.

auth_sentence.content: Nor does he believe in setting his sights low.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nor does he believe in setting his sights low.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nor does he believe in setting his sights low.

auth_sentence.content: They walked the Mall, took in the sights.
auth_sentence.res_content: They walked the Mall, took in the sights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They walked the Mall, took in the sights.

Sentence.sentence: Monarch butterflies, the large origin black insects, are common summer sights in northern United States and Canada.
